About This Journey

This 30-day portfolio journey represents a structured approach to demonstrating expertise in federated learning security, fraud detection, and AI safety research. Each phase builds upon the previous one, creating a comprehensive narrative of growth and capability.

Learning Philosophy

  • Hands-on First: Every concept is implemented in code
  • Production Focus: Emphasis on deployable, maintainable systems
  • Research-Driven: Projects connect to academic research and real-world problems
  • Documentation: All work is thoroughly documented and shared

Key Milestones

  • Days 1-5: Establish strong fundamentals in fraud detection
  • Days 6-10: Core federated learning concepts and SignGuard inception
  • Days 11-15: Production-grade ML infrastructure
  • Days 16-20: Advanced security research and threat analysis
  • Days 21-25: Cross-institution FL simulation
  • Days 26-30: Full system integration and documentation

Research Alignment

Each project in this journey is designed to demonstrate capabilities relevant to PhD/MPhill research in:

  • Byzantine-resilient federated learning
  • Cryptographic verification for ML systems
  • Privacy-preserving machine learning
  • Adversarial robustness and defense mechanisms
A
Azka

Building secure federated learning systems for financial applications. Research focus on adversarial robustness and cryptographic verification.
